metadata.description: GPU and ANGLE configuration recommendations for WebGL rendering

gpu.notes: Intel Arc discrete GPUs work best with D3D11 backend. Ensure you have the latest drivers from Intel Download Center. Arc GPUs benefit from driver updates for optimal WebGL performance.

issue.problem: Polylines not rendered correctly in Cesium/Propeller
issue.solution: Use D3D11 WARP backend for Cesium applications. This fixes rendering but will reduce performance of browser across all pages.
Update to latest Intel Arc drivers (version 31.0.101.5333 or newer). If issue persists, use D3D11 WARP backend as temporary workaround.
Ensure GPU is not in power-saving mode. Check Windows Graphics Settings and set browser to "High Performance" mode.

performance.backend: Software fallback, fixes line rendering issues

gpu.notes: Intel UHD integrated graphics perform well with D3D11 backend. For better performance, ensure laptop is plugged in and not in battery-saving mode.

issue.solution: D3D11 works well for both standard and Cesium applications
Connect to AC power or adjust Windows power plan to "High Performance"

gpu.notes: Intel Iris Xe graphics offer excellent integrated GPU performance. D3D11 is optimal for WebGL workloads.

issue.solution: D3D11 works well for both standard and Cesium applications

issue.problem: Occasional texture corruption in complex scenes
issue.solution: Update to latest Intel graphics drivers. Clear browser cache and restart.

gpu.notes: NVIDIA RTX GPUs provide excellent WebGL performance with D3D11 backend. No known issues with line rendering.

issue.solution: Excellent performance with D3D11 for all WebGL applications
Enable shader cache in browser settings. First load may be slower, subsequent loads will be faster.

gpu.notes: NVIDIA GTX GPUs work well with D3D11 backend. Ensure drivers are up to date for best performance.

issue.solution: Good performance with D3D11 for all WebGL applications

issue.problem: Older GTX cards (600/700 series) may have reduced WebGL2 performance
issue.solution: Use WebGL 1.0 contexts where possible. Update to latest Game Ready drivers.

gpu.notes: AMD Radeon GPUs perform well with D3D11 backend. Ensure Adrenalin drivers are up to date.

issue.solution: D3D11 recommended for both standard and Cesium applications

issue.problem: Some Radeon RX 5000 series cards experience texture flickering
issue.solution: Update to AMD Adrenalin 23.11.1 or newer. Disable Enhanced Sync in Radeon Settings.

issue.problem: WebGL performance may vary with power profile
issue.solution: Set "Graphics Profile" to "High" in AMD Radeon Settings for browser executable

gpu.notes: Generic GPU detected. D3D11 is the recommended backend for most hardware. If experiencing issues, try D3D11 WARP software renderer.

issue.problem: GPU not recognized or masked by browser policy
issue.solution: Check browser security policies. Enterprise environments may restrict GPU information access.

browser.name: Chrome
browser.notes: Chrome uses ANGLE on Windows for WebGL rendering. Backend can be changed via chrome://flags

browser.name: Edge
browser.notes: Edge (Chromium) uses ANGLE on Windows for WebGL rendering. Backend can be changed via edge://flags

browser.name: Firefox
browser.notes: Firefox uses ANGLE on Windows but with limited configuration options. See about:config for webgl.angle settings

backend.name: D3D11
backend.pros: Best performance, wide hardware support, production-ready
backend.cons: May have line rendering artifacts on some GPUs (notably Intel Arc with older drivers)

backend.name: D3D11on12
backend.pros: Leverages D3D12 optimizations, good performance on newer hardware
backend.cons: Experimental, may have compatibility issues, requires Windows 10 1809+
backend.recommendedFor: Latest generation GPUs (2020 and newer), testing environments

backend.name: D3D9
backend.pros: Maximum compatibility, works on older hardware

backend.name: D3D11 WARP
backend.description: Windows Advanced Rasterization Platform - Software renderer
backend.pros: Fixes line rendering issues, no GPU required, consistent behavior
backend.cons: Significantly reduced performance (CPU-based), not suitable for complex scenes
backend.recommendedFor: Troubleshooting rendering issues, systems without compatible GPU
